name: Hotel Acta Atrium Palace

reviews.text: The Atrium Palace was a great find in Barcelona! The hotel is in an excellent location in the Eixample area, within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas, two metro stations and the Placa Catalunya. The rooms are tiny but well appointed with great showers and nice toiletries. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the Gran Via, and it was quite nice to sit outside and read a book for a while after walking around all day. The traffic on the Gran Via is quite noisy, but the room must have extra thick glass, as you could barely hear any outside noise once you closed the sliding door. The staff was superb, and every restaurant they recommended was excellent. We booked our rooms online and were able to take advantage of the $7.50E breakfast price. The buffet is very nice with both hot and cold items as well as cappuccino's etc. on request. There is also free water and juice in the room minibars which are refilled daily.
reviews.title: Atrium Palace is an excellent choice
Very pleasant stay in Barcelona!
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again, should we return to Barcelone.

reviews.title: impressive atrium palace
reviews.text: We traveled to Spain for a company trade show. All our reservations were handled online. The hotel was very prompt in getting back to us by email if we had a question about our upcoming reservations. There were 18 in our party and we had 9 rooms. It was very clean and quiet. The service at the front desk was very helpful in setting up dinner arrangements and entertainment for our large group. The language barrier was not a problem. There was at least one person at the desk that spoke English every time we needed assistance with something. We were in Barcelona for 3 nights, we spent about 180 euro's a night but this included an excellent breakfast each morning. The rooms varied quite a bit in size and in view. Everything in Barcelona is tight packed. Our particular room was small but adaquite. The bathrooms were very nice and the showers excellent with plentiful hot water and water pressure. Some on the rooms had views of the street and were bigger in size, some looked at the brick wall of the building next door, some overlooked a school yard. We didn't go to Barcelona to spend time in our room so the size and view really wasn't an issue. The air conditioning worked great, for some reason the hall ways and elevators were very warm. The elevators everywhere we went were tiny. This hotel was no exception. We tight packed it into the elevator with just my husband and I and 5 pieces of luggage. These elevators were not built for wide bodied Americans!! The location was excellent for many of the sights. I'd reccommend this hotel for a pleasant but not extravagant stay in Barcelona. The use of the computers in the business center was free, everyone in our group enjoyed that feature. I never made it down to the spa or exercise area's so can't make a comment on them.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay (April 21-25) this hotel is lovely, ultra-modern and very clean. It has a fantastic location just inside the nicer area of "Eixample". The breakfast was a great offer at 50% and had absolutely everything and was well worth the full price it should have been!

Comfort lovers this is for you.
reviews.text: Our stay was totally ruined by the location of our room which over-looked a square in the centre of the group of buildings - the square was a school playground. The air-conditioning didn't work in our room we had to sleep with the windows open. By 8am it was impossible to sleep and the noise continued all day until around 8pm (the school became a sports pitch at night). The sound of 200 kids screeming really drills into your skull after 2 days.
If you do stay at this hotel, don't accept a room adjacent to the playground from hell!
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel that is clean, quiet and comfortable. The rooms are well equipped and the sound proofing first class. The buffet breakfast is top value for money and relatively cheap if booked at the time via the hotel website (half price ) The free juice and bottled water is a nice touch as is the chocolates in the evening. The 24 hour free internet access helped add to that "nice touch". Overall the hotel is terrific value for money and ideally suited for those seeking somewhere quiet in a quiet area that is close to all the local ammenities. The only downside, though not everyone will agree, is that the bar and lounge area is very quiet in the evenings and closes at 12 midnight but the bar prices are amongst the cheapest in the whole of Barcelona. Excellent value for money and well worth a visit!!
reviews.title: Spa under renovatoin at the Atrium Palace

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of December for my husband's 30th. We booked direct with the hotel, requested a double room at the front on one of the upper floors, and got all of our requests. The room was clean, big enough, with free juice and water, and the hotel is in a fantastic location - it's only 10 minutes walk from where the Ryanair bus from Girona drops you, and a few blocks from the Ramblas. Good tapas bars nearby, which the hotel staff recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel - recommended
Loved the Atrium Palace
reviews.text: We had to ask a couple of times for the complimentary Cava for my husband's birthday, but staff were very apologetic and brought it up. We didn't get a chance to use the pool - so much to do in Barcelona in a weekend! I thought the hotel was great value in such a good location and would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Cheap finishing - poor insulation
Bring your ear plugs
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel from 27th December 2007 till 4th January 2008. We were given a spatious room at the front of the building overlooking the Gran Via. The rooms look great at first glance. At closer inspection you wil find that they are very cheaply finished. Sound insulation is below par especially between rooms. We were able to hear and understand the neighbours very clearly. The piping is done in such a bad way that every time a toilet is flushed or a bath tub emptied on one of the upper floors it generates an extremely loud roar which even wakes you up at night. The noise from the street side was acceptable. Our last night the poor plumbing finally gave way and the ceiling came down after the constantly battered piping had given way to yet another flushed toiled and emptied bath tub. We were appropriately moved to another room without further discussion. All in all : cheaply finished hotel, bad insulation, noisy, good location, over-priced. Maybe rather 3 than 4 star. Would not stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice room decor, clean, OK except for the noise!!! Our room # 307 was in the back area and just above an enclosed SCHOOL PLAYGROUND, which gave us no hope to sleep late. Additionally, this room had bizarre plumbing - every time the upstairs guest flushed or turned on the water, it would drian down through our pipes and toilet making very loud water running noises at any hour! The flooring also let us be aware of every step upstairs or in the hallway. Also the Housekeeping closet was next to the room, adding to the symphony of noise. When I asked to change rooms, I was informed there were none available.... This was by far the noisest hotel I have ever expereienced. The desk staff was polite upon arrival, those that knew English, but the wait staff in the bar and restaurant were chilly and very indifferent. Barcelona is a lovely city and we will choose to stay eleswhere on our next visit.

description: Acta Atrium Palace is a 4 stars hotel located in the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes, one of the main roads of the city of Barcelona and just few minutes walk from Paseo de Gracia and Plaza Catalunya.Acta Atrium Palace has 67 rooms decorated in a modern and subtle style and feature parquet flooring and Venetian stucco, with a cream and brown colour scheme.
